skill.name: firebase-development-project-setup
skill.description: This skill should be used when initializing a new Firebase project with proven architecture. Triggers on "new firebase project", "initialize firebase", "firebase init", "set up firebase", "create firebase app", "start firebase project". Guides through CLI setup, architecture choices, and emulator configuration.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when initializing a new Firebase project with proven architecture. Trigger...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only guidance for Firebase project setup. All 103 static findings are false positives: markdown backticks were misidentified as shell execution, text patterns were misclassified as cryptographic references, and heuristic patterns triggered on standard development documentation. The skill provides only instructional content with no executable code, network calls, or credential access capabilities. Environment file references (lines 77, 139, 141, 172) document proper .gitignore practices and emulator configuration templates, not credential access. Localhost URLs (127.0.0.1:4000) are for Firebase emulator UI only.

content.value_statement: Starting a new Firebase project involves many architectural decisions that affect long-term maintainability. This skill guides you through CLI setup, architecture patterns, and emulator configuration with proven best practices from production deployments.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new Firebase projects with Firebase CLI and TypeScript
Guide architecture decisions for hosting, auth, functions, and security
Configure emulators with single-project mode and UI dashboard
Set up project structure for Express API, domain-grouped, or individual function patterns
Create Firestore security rules with helper functions and default deny
Establish testing infrastructure with Vitest for emulator-based tests
limitations: Does not execute Firebase CLI commands directly - provides guidance only
Does not create actual Firebase projects in your Google Cloud account
Does not handle existing Firebase project migration or import
Does not deploy to production - only covers local development setup

use_cases.title: New Firebase project initialization
use_cases.description: Start a production-ready Firebase project with TypeScript functions, emulator testing, and proper architecture patterns.

use_cases.title: Cloud Functions architecture
use_cases.description: Choose the right functions architecture (Express API, domain-grouped, or individual files) based on your use case.

use_cases.title: Local emulator setup
use_cases.description: Configure Firebase emulators for local development with proper testing infrastructure before deploying to production.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Firebase init
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to start a new Firebase project. Initialize it with TypeScript functions and set up the emulators for local development.

prompt_templates.title: With architecture
prompt_templates.scenario: Create Firebase project with specific requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Firebase project with Express API architecture for the functions, Firebase Auth for authentication, and multiple hosting sites.

prompt_templates.title: Complete setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Full Firebase project with all decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a complete Firebase project: TypeScript functions, domain-grouped structure, client-write security model, and Vitest testing configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Migration prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a production-ready Firebase project structure with Biome linting, emulator configuration, and all necessary configuration files ready for CI/CD deployment.

output_examples.input: I need to start a new Firebase project with TypeScript and emulators
output: Step 1: Verify Firebase CLI and login status
Step 2: Create project directory with git initialization
Step 3: Run firebase init with Firestore, Functions, Hosting, Emulators
Step 4: Configure architecture choices (hosting, auth, functions, security)
Step 5: Set up firebase.json with emulator configuration
Step 6: Create functions structure based on architecture pattern
Step 8: Set up Vitest with emulator configuration
Step 9: Start emulators and verify all services
Step 10: Create initial tests and verify build passes

output_examples.input: Set up a Firebase project with Express API functions and Firebase Auth
output: Creating project structure for Express API architecture
Setting up middleware, tools, and services directories
Configuring Firebase Auth with login UI integration
Creating API key guard for programmatic access

best_practices: Always configure emulators from the start - this enables testing without accruing cloud costs
Choose architecture patterns early (Express API vs domain-grouped vs individual files) to maintain consistency
Use TypeScript for all functions and add ABOUTME comments to every file for discoverability
anti_patterns: Skipping emulator setup and testing directly against production - this incurs costs and risks data
Choosing architecture patterns inconsistently across functions - leads to maintenance debt
Not setting up CI/CD and testing infrastructure before writing features

faq.question: Which architecture pattern should I choose for Cloud Functions?
faq.answer: Express API for many related endpoints needing middleware. Domain-grouped for feature-rich apps with distinct areas. Individual files for maximum modularity.

faq.question: What Firebase services should I enable during init?
faq.answer: Enable Firestore, Functions, Hosting, and Emulators. These cover database, backend logic, static assets, and local development.

faq.question: How do I test without accruing cloud costs?
faq.answer: Use Firebase emulators for all development. Configure singleProjectMode in firebase.json and set NEXT_PUBLIC_USE_EMULATORS=true.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. It does not execute commands, access files outside standard Claude operations, or transmit any data.

faq.question: Why am I getting Firebase CLI not found error?
faq.answer: Install Firebase CLI with npm install -g firebase-tools. Verify with firebase --version. Ensure npm global packages are in your PATH.

faq.question: How is this different from Firebase Console?
faq.answer: Firebase Console creates cloud projects. This skill sets up local development with TypeScript, testing, and emulator configuration for productive development.
